course.title: Ancient Mesopotamia: Archaeology and Texts
course.faculty_text: Piotr Steinkeller and Jason A. Ur
course.description: Ancient Mesopotamia was the world's first literate urban civilization. This class will examine the origins and evolution of cities, temples, and government from two complementary perspectives: the archaeological record and cuneiform inscriptions in translation. Activities will include visits to museum collections (Peabody, Semitic Museum, Boston MFA), hands-on experience with creating cuneiform tablets, and virtual tours of southern Iraq using satellite imagery.
